messages.content:
You are an expert TECHNICAL SALES ASSISTANT for Teklab, a leading manufacturer of liquid level sensors and controllers for industrial applications.

üåç LANGUAGE ADAPTATION - ABSOLUTE PRIORITY:
**CRITICAL**: ALWAYS respond in the EXACT SAME LANGUAGE as the user's question.

MISSION: Provide expert technical consultation on Teklab products, helping customers select the right sensor/controller for their specific application, troubleshoot issues, and optimize system performance.

STYLE: Technical but accessible, consultative and solution-oriented, precise and data-driven, focus on PRACTICAL APPLICATION and PROBLEM SOLVING.

SEMANTIC CONCEPT: TK3+ 46bar Refrigerant Compatibility and Oil Selection

üéØ CUSTOMER QUESTION THIS CHUNK ANSWERS:
"Which refrigerants can I use with TK3+ 46bar? What oils are compatible? Will it work with R410A, R134a, R404A, R407C, or ammonia?"

üìã COMPLETE REFRIGERANT COMPATIBILITY GUIDE:

---

**1. COMPATIBLE REFRIGERANTS (TESTED & APPROVED)**

**HFC Refrigerants (Hydrofluorocarbons):**

‚úÖ **R134a** (1,1,1,2-Tetrafluoroethane)
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: Medium-temp refrigeration, chillers, automotive AC
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~6.6 bar (low pressure)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 2-12 bar typical
‚Ä¢ Oil type: POE (Polyolester) or PAG (Polyalkylene Glycol)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ compatibility: **EXCELLENT** - well within 46 bar rating
‚Ä¢ Market status: Widely used, stable availability
‚Ä¢ GWP: 1430 (moderate environmental impact)

‚úÖ **R404A** (R125/143a/134a blend)
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: Low-temp refrigeration, freezers, cold storage
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~12 bar (medium pressure)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 5-18 bar typical
‚Ä¢ Oil type: POE (Polyolester) mandatory
‚Ä¢ TK3+ compatibility: **EXCELLENT** - safe operating margin
‚Ä¢ Market status: Being phased out (EU F-Gas regulation), use R448A/R449A alternatives
‚Ä¢ GWP: 3922 (high environmental impact)

‚úÖ **R407C** (R32/125/134a blend)
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: Air conditioning, heat pumps, medium-temp refrigeration
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~11 bar (medium pressure)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 4-16 bar typical
‚Ä¢ Oil type: POE (Polyolester)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ compatibility: **EXCELLENT** - common commercial refrigerant
‚Ä¢ Market status: Stable, widely available
‚Ä¢ GWP: 1774 (moderate-high environmental impact)

‚úÖ **R410A** (R32/125 blend)
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: Air conditioning, VRF systems, heat pumps
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~15.8 bar (high pressure)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 8-28 bar typical
‚Ä¢ Oil type: POE (Polyolester) mandatory
‚Ä¢ TK3+ compatibility: **GOOD** - use TK3+ 46bar for low-temp stages only
‚Ä¢ **IMPORTANT**: For high-temp condensing (>35¬∞C), use **TK3+ 80bar** instead (safer margin)
‚Ä¢ Market status: Very common in AC systems
‚Ä¢ GWP: 2088 (high environmental impact)

‚úÖ **R448A / R449A** (Low-GWP R404A replacements)
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: Retrofit for R404A systems (cold storage, freezers)
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~12-13 bar (similar to R404A)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 5-18 bar typical
‚Ä¢ Oil type: POE (Polyolester)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ compatibility: **EXCELLENT** - direct R404A replacement
‚Ä¢ Market status: Growing adoption (EU F-Gas compliant)
‚Ä¢ GWP: 1387 (R448A) / 1397 (R449A) - much lower than R404A

‚úÖ **R452A / R454B** (Low-GWP R410A replacements)
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: Retrofit for R410A AC systems
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~15-16 bar (similar to R410A)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 8-26 bar typical
‚Ä¢ Oil type: POE (Polyolester)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ compatibility: **GOOD** - use TK3+ 80bar for high-temp condensing
‚Ä¢ Market status: Emerging alternatives (A2L mildly flammable classification)
‚Ä¢ GWP: 2141 (R452A) / 466 (R454B)

---

**HCFC Refrigerants (Hydrochlorofluorocarbons - Legacy):**

‚úÖ **R22** (Chlorodifluoromethane)
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: OLD air conditioning, refrigeration (being phased out)
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~10.5 bar (medium pressure)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 4-15 bar typical
‚Ä¢ Oil type: Mineral oil or Alkylbenzene (AB)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ compatibility: **EXCELLENT** - legacy systems still in operation
‚Ä¢ Market status: **BANNED** in EU/US for new equipment (Montreal Protocol)
‚Ä¢ Use for: Service/maintenance of existing R22 systems only

---

**Natural Refrigerants:**

‚ö†Ô∏è **R717 (Ammonia / NH3)**
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: Industrial refrigeration, cold storage, ice rinks
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~10 bar (medium pressure)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 2-18 bar typical
‚Ä¢ Oil type: Mineral oil or POE (ammonia-compatible)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ compatibility: **NOT RECOMMENDED** - ammonia is highly corrosive
‚Ä¢ **Alternative**: Use **ATEX Metallic IR Sensor** (316L stainless steel, ammonia-resistant)
‚Ä¢ Safety: Ammonia is toxic (TLV 25 ppm), requires special materials
‚Ä¢ Market status: Widely used in industrial applications (zero GWP)

‚ùå **R744 (CO2 / Carbon Dioxide)**
‚Ä¢ Typical applications: Supermarket refrigeration, heat pumps, transcritical systems
‚Ä¢ Operating pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~60 bar (HIGH pressure - transcritical)
‚Ä¢ Working pressure range: 30-130 bar (subcritical/transcritical)
‚Ä¢ Oil type: POE (CO2-specific formulation)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar compatibility: **NOT SUITABLE** - exceeds 46 bar rating
‚Ä¢ **Alternative**: Use **TK3+ 130bar** (rated up to 130 bar for CO2 systems)
‚Ä¢ Market status: Growing rapidly (natural refrigerant, GWP = 1)

---

**2. OIL COMPATIBILITY MATRIX**

**POE (Polyolester) Oils - Most Common:**
‚úÖ Highly hygroscopic (absorbs moisture) - requires careful handling
‚úÖ Compatible with: R134a, R404A, R407C, R410A, R448A, R449A, R452A, R454B, CO2
‚úÖ TK3+ detection: **EXCELLENT** - POE oils are translucent/clear
‚úÖ Refraction index: Optimal for IR sensor performance
‚úÖ Viscosity range: ISO 32, 68, 100 (all work well)
‚úÖ Brands tested: Mobil EAL Arctic, Castrol Icematic SW, Fuchs Reniso Triton SEZ

**Mineral Oil - Legacy Systems:**
‚úÖ Compatible with: R22, ammonia (NH3)
‚úÖ TK3+ detection: **GOOD** - slightly opaque but detectable
‚úÖ Refraction index: Lower than POE (still within sensor range)
‚úÖ Viscosity range: ISO 32, 46, 68
‚úÖ Use for: Old R22 systems, ammonia industrial (with ATEX sensor instead)

**PAG (Polyalkylene Glycol) - Automotive AC:**
‚úÖ Compatible with: R134a (automotive applications)
‚úÖ TK3+ detection: **GOOD** - clear oil, good IR transmission
‚úÖ Hygroscopic: Absorbs moisture (store sealed)
‚úÖ Use for: Mobile AC compressors (cars, trucks, buses)

**Alkylbenzene (AB) - Synthetic:**
‚úÖ Compatible with: R22, R134a (retrofit applications)
‚úÖ TK3+ detection: **EXCELLENT** - clear, stable oil
‚úÖ Miscibility: Partial with mineral oil (good for R22 conversions)
‚úÖ Use for: R22 system conversions to R407C or R134a

---

**3. OIL CHARACTERISTICS AFFECTING DETECTION**

**Why IR Sensor Works with All Oils:**
The TK3+ uses electro-optic infrared (IR) technology that detects the **refractive index change** between air and liquid. This principle works with:
‚Ä¢ Clear oils (POE, PAG) - optimal performance
‚Ä¢ Translucent oils (fresh mineral oil) - very good performance
‚Ä¢ Slightly contaminated oils (aged, darkened) - good performance
‚Ä¢ Opaque oils (heavily contaminated) - acceptable performance

**Oil Properties That DON'T Affect Detection:**
‚ùå Oil color (clear, amber, dark) - sensor works regardless
‚ùå Oil viscosity (ISO 32 to 220) - no impact on detection
‚ùå Oil temperature (-40¬∞C to +125¬∞C) - sensor compensated
‚ùå Oil conductivity or hardness - not a factor (unlike capacitive sensors)

**Oil Properties That HELP Detection:**
‚úÖ Clean oil (no particles) - reduces optical contamination
‚úÖ Proper refrigerant miscibility - prevents stratification
‚úÖ Low moisture content - prevents corrosion and foaming

---

**4. PRESSURE RATING SELECTION GUIDE**

**When to Use TK3+ 46bar:**
‚úÖ R134a systems (all temperatures) - max ~12 bar
‚úÖ R404A low/medium temp - max ~18 bar
‚úÖ R407C systems - max ~16 bar
‚úÖ R22 legacy systems - max ~15 bar
‚úÖ R448A/R449A (R404A replacements) - max ~18 bar
‚úÖ R410A LOW-TEMP stages only (<20 bar) - condenser use TK3+ 80bar

**When to Use TK3+ 80bar Instead:**
‚ö†Ô∏è R410A high-temp condensing (>28 bar) - safer margin
‚ö†Ô∏è R404A high ambient (>40¬∞C) - pressure spikes
‚ö†Ô∏è R407C in hot climates (>45¬∞C ambient) - safety factor
‚ö†Ô∏è R452A AC systems - similar pressure to R410A
‚ö†Ô∏è Systems with pressure transients (liquid slugging, hot gas defrost)

**When to Use TK3+ 130bar Instead:**
‚ùå CO2 (R744) transcritical - 60-130 bar operating range
‚ùå CO2 subcritical - 30-60 bar (still exceeds 46 bar rating)
‚ùå High-pressure test applications - requires >80 bar rating

---

**5. REFRIGERANT SAFETY & REGULATIONS**

**EU F-Gas Regulation (517/2014):**
‚Ä¢ Phase-down of high-GWP refrigerants (R404A, R410A)
‚Ä¢ Encourage low-GWP alternatives (R448A, R449A, R32, R454B)
‚Ä¢ Mandatory leak detection for systems >500 kg refrigerant
‚Ä¢ TK3+ helps comply: Oil level monitoring prevents compressor damage and refrigerant leaks

**ASHRAE Safety Classifications:**
‚Ä¢ **A1** (non-toxic, non-flammable): R134a, R404A, R407C, R410A - safest class
‚Ä¢ **A2L** (non-toxic, mildly flammable): R32, R452A, R454B - requires leak detection
‚Ä¢ **B2** (toxic, flammable): R717 (ammonia) - requires ATEX sensors in hazardous zones

**ATEX Requirements:**
‚Ä¢ Ammonia (R717) systems in explosive atmospheres: Use **ATEX Metallic IR Sensor** (Ex d IIC T6 certified)
‚Ä¢ Flammable refrigerants (A2L, A3 class): Standard TK3+ acceptable (no ignition source)
‚Ä¢ Hydrogen-enriched oils: May require ATEX sensor (consult Teklab)

---

**6. QUICK SELECTION TABLE**

| Refrigerant | Oil Type | Max Pressure | TK3+ Model | Status |
|------------|----------|--------------|------------|--------|
| R134a | POE/PAG | ~12 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Active |
| R404A | POE | ~18 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Phasing out |
| R407C | POE | ~16 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Active |
| R410A | POE | ~28 bar | **TK3+ 80bar** ‚ö†Ô∏è | Active |
| R448A/R449A | POE | ~18 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Growing |
| R452A/R454B | POE | ~26 bar | **TK3+ 80bar** ‚ö†Ô∏è | Emerging |
| R22 | Mineral/AB | ~15 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Legacy only |
| R717 (NH3) | Mineral/POE | ~18 bar | **ATEX Metallic** ‚ö†Ô∏è | Active |
| R744 (CO2) | POE | 60-130 bar | **TK3+ 130bar** ‚ùå | Growing |

---

**SUMMARY - TK3+ 46bar Refrigerant Compatibility:**

‚úÖ **EXCELLENT for**: R134a, R404A, R407C, R448A, R449A, R22 (legacy)
‚ö†Ô∏è **USE WITH CAUTION**: R410A (low-temp stages only, use TK3+ 80bar for condensers)
‚ùå **NOT SUITABLE**: CO2/R744 (use TK3+ 130bar), Ammonia/R717 (use ATEX Metallic IR)

‚úÖ **ALL POE OILS**: Fully compatible (ISO 32, 68, 100)
‚úÖ **MINERAL & AB OILS**: Compatible (R22 systems, ammonia with ATEX sensor)
‚úÖ **PAG OILS**: Compatible (automotive R134a)

**Need Specific Refrigerant Advice?**
Contact Teklab technical support with your:
‚Ä¢ Refrigerant type and operating pressures (evap/cond)
‚Ä¢ Oil type and viscosity grade
‚Ä¢ Ambient temperature range
‚Ä¢ Application (commercial refrigeration, AC, industrial)

We'll recommend the optimal TK3+ model and configuration for your system.

**TK3+ 46bar Refrigerant & Oil Compatibility Guide**

Complete technical reference for refrigerant compatibility, oil selection, and pressure rating guidance for the TK3+ 46bar oil level controller.

---

**COMPATIBLE REFRIGERANTS (TESTED & APPROVED)**

**HFC Refrigerants - Fully Compatible:**

‚úÖ **R134a** (Medium-temp refrigeration, chillers)
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~6.6 bar | Range: 2-12 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: POE or PAG
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: **EXCELLENT** - well within rating
‚Ä¢ Status: Widely used, stable

‚úÖ **R404A** (Low-temp freezers, cold storage)  
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~12 bar | Range: 5-18 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: POE mandatory
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: **EXCELLENT** - safe margin
‚Ä¢ Status: Phasing out (use R448A/R449A alternatives)

‚úÖ **R407C** (Air conditioning, heat pumps)
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~11 bar | Range: 4-16 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: POE
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: **EXCELLENT** - common commercial refrigerant
‚Ä¢ Status: Stable, widely available

‚ö†Ô∏è **R410A** (AC systems, VRF, heat pumps)
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~15.8 bar | Range: 8-28 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: POE mandatory
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: **USE WITH CAUTION** - OK for low-temp stages only
‚Ä¢ **IMPORTANT**: For high-temp condensing (>28 bar), use **TK3+ 80bar** instead
‚Ä¢ Status: Very common in AC

‚úÖ **R448A / R449A** (Low-GWP R404A replacements)
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~12-13 bar | Range: 5-18 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: POE
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: **EXCELLENT** - direct R404A replacement
‚Ä¢ Status: Growing (EU F-Gas compliant, GWP <1400)

‚úÖ **R452A / R454B** (Low-GWP R410A replacements)
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~15-16 bar | Range: 8-26 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: POE
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: Use **TK3+ 80bar** for high-temp stages
‚Ä¢ Status: Emerging (A2L mildly flammable)

---

**Legacy HCFC Refrigerants:**

‚úÖ **R22** (OLD AC/refrigeration - phased out)
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~10.5 bar | Range: 4-15 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: Mineral oil or Alkylbenzene (AB)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: **EXCELLENT** - for existing R22 systems
‚Ä¢ Status: **BANNED** for new equipment (Montreal Protocol) - service only

---

**Natural Refrigerants - Special Requirements:**

‚ö†Ô∏è **R717 (Ammonia / NH3)** - NOT RECOMMENDED
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~10 bar | Range: 2-18 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: Mineral oil or POE (ammonia-compatible)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: **NOT SUITABLE** - ammonia is highly corrosive
‚Ä¢ **Alternative**: Use **ATEX Metallic IR Sensor** (316L stainless steel, ammonia-resistant)
‚Ä¢ Safety: Toxic (TLV 25 ppm), requires special materials

‚ùå **R744 (CO2 / Carbon Dioxide)** - EXCEEDS RATING
‚Ä¢ Pressure @ 25¬∞C: ~60 bar (transcritical) | Range: 30-130 bar
‚Ä¢ Oil: POE (CO2-specific)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ 46bar: **NOT SUITABLE** - exceeds 46 bar rating
‚Ä¢ **Alternative**: Use **TK3+ 130bar** (rated up to 130 bar)
‚Ä¢ Status: Growing rapidly (natural refrigerant, GWP = 1)

---

**OIL COMPATIBILITY MATRIX**

**POE (Polyolester) Oils - Most Common:**
‚úÖ Compatible refrigerants: R134a, R404A, R407C, R410A, R448A, R449A, R452A, R454B, CO2
‚úÖ TK3+ detection: **EXCELLENT** - POE oils are clear/translucent
‚úÖ Viscosity: ISO 32, 68, 100 (all work well)
‚úÖ Tested brands: Mobil EAL Arctic, Castrol Icematic SW, Fuchs Reniso Triton SEZ
‚ö†Ô∏è Note: Highly hygroscopic (absorbs moisture) - requires careful handling

**Mineral Oil - Legacy Systems:**
‚úÖ Compatible refrigerants: R22, ammonia (NH3)
‚úÖ TK3+ detection: **GOOD** - slightly opaque but detectable
‚úÖ Viscosity: ISO 32, 46, 68
‚úÖ Use: Old R22 systems, ammonia industrial (prefer ATEX sensor for NH3)

**PAG (Polyalkylene Glycol) - Automotive:**
‚úÖ Compatible refrigerants: R134a (automotive AC)
‚úÖ TK3+ detection: **GOOD** - clear oil, good IR transmission
‚úÖ Use: Mobile AC compressors (cars, trucks, buses)

**Alkylbenzene (AB) - Synthetic:**
‚úÖ Compatible refrigerants: R22, R134a (retrofit)
‚úÖ TK3+ detection: **EXCELLENT** - clear, stable
‚úÖ Use: R22 system conversions to R407C or R134a

---

**WHY IR SENSOR WORKS WITH ALL OILS**

The TK3+ electro-optic infrared (IR) technology detects **refractive index change** between air and liquid. This principle works with:

‚úÖ Clear oils (POE, PAG) - optimal performance  
‚úÖ Translucent oils (fresh mineral) - very good  
‚úÖ Slightly contaminated oils (aged) - good  
‚úÖ Opaque oils (heavily contaminated) - acceptable  

**Oil properties that DON'T affect detection:**
‚ùå Oil color (clear, amber, dark)
‚ùå Oil viscosity (ISO 32 to 220)
‚ùå Oil temperature (-40¬∞C to +125¬∞C)
‚ùå Oil conductivity or hardness (unlike capacitive sensors)

---

**PRESSURE RATING SELECTION GUIDE**

**Use TK3+ 46bar for:**
‚úÖ R134a systems (all temperatures) - max ~12 bar
‚úÖ R404A low/medium temp - max ~18 bar
‚úÖ R407C systems - max ~16 bar
‚úÖ R22 legacy systems - max ~15 bar
‚úÖ R448A/R449A (R404A replacements) - max ~18 bar
‚úÖ R410A LOW-TEMP stages only (<20 bar)

**Use TK3+ 80bar for:**
‚ö†Ô∏è R410A high-temp condensing (>28 bar)
‚ö†Ô∏è R404A high ambient (>40¬∞C) - pressure spikes
‚ö†Ô∏è R452A AC systems - similar to R410A
‚ö†Ô∏è Systems with pressure transients (hot gas defrost)

**Use TK3+ 130bar for:**
‚ùå CO2 (R744) transcritical/subcritical - 30-130 bar
‚ùå High-pressure test applications (>80 bar)

---

**QUICK SELECTION TABLE**

| Refrigerant | Oil Type | Max Pressure | Recommended Model | Status |
|------------|----------|--------------|------------------|--------|
| R134a | POE/PAG | ~12 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Active |
| R404A | POE | ~18 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Phasing out |
| R407C | POE | ~16 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Active |
| R410A | POE | ~28 bar | **TK3+ 80bar** ‚ö†Ô∏è | Active |
| R448A/R449A | POE | ~18 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Growing |
| R452A/R454B | POE | ~26 bar | **TK3+ 80bar** ‚ö†Ô∏è | Emerging |
| R22 | Mineral/AB | ~15 bar | **TK3+ 46bar** ‚úÖ | Legacy |
| R717 (NH3) | Mineral/POE | ~18 bar | **ATEX Metallic** ‚ö†Ô∏è | Active |
| R744 (CO2) | POE | 60-130 bar | **TK3+ 130bar** ‚ùå | Growing |

---

**REGULATIONS & SAFETY**

**EU F-Gas Regulation (517/2014):**
‚Ä¢ Phase-down high-GWP refrigerants (R404A, R410A)
‚Ä¢ Encourage low-GWP alternatives (R448A, R32, R454B)
‚Ä¢ TK3+ helps comply: Oil monitoring prevents compressor damage and leaks

**ASHRAE Safety Classes:**
‚Ä¢ **A1** (non-toxic, non-flammable): R134a, R404A, R407C, R410A - standard TK3+
‚Ä¢ **A2L** (mildly flammable): R32, R452A, R454B - standard TK3+ (no ignition source)
‚Ä¢ **B2** (toxic, flammable): R717 (ammonia) - requires ATEX sensor in hazardous zones

---

**SUMMARY**

‚úÖ **EXCELLENT for**: R134a, R404A, R407C, R448A, R449A, R22 (legacy)  
‚ö†Ô∏è **USE WITH CAUTION**: R410A (low-temp only, prefer TK3+ 80bar for condensers)  
‚ùå **NOT SUITABLE**: CO2 (use TK3+ 130bar), Ammonia (use ATEX Metallic IR)  

‚úÖ **ALL POE OILS**: Fully compatible  
‚úÖ **MINERAL & AB OILS**: Compatible  
‚úÖ **PAG OILS**: Compatible  

**Need Specific Advice?**
Contact Teklab with your refrigerant type, operating pressures, oil type, and application for optimal model recommendation.

metadata.semantic_concept: Complete refrigerant and oil compatibility reference for TK3+ 46bar
customer_questions_answered: Can I use TK3+ 46bar with R410A?
Is TK3+ compatible with R134a, R404A, R407C?
What oils work with TK3+ sensor?
Can I use TK3+ with ammonia (R717)?
Which TK3+ model for low-GWP refrigerants?
Does TK3+ work with POE, mineral, or PAG oils?
When should I use TK3+ 80bar instead of 46bar?
Is TK3+ compatible with R448A, R449A, R452A?
competitive_advantages: Works with ALL oil types (POE, mineral, PAG, AB) - not affected by conductivity
Detects contaminated/darkened oils - unlike optical sensors requiring clean oil
No calibration needed for different refrigerants - universal IR detection
Temperature compensated - accurate across full -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C range
Compatible with low-GWP refrigerants (R448A, R449A, R452A) - future-proof
related_products: ATEX Metallic IR Sensor (for ammonia/R717 systems)
TK4 MODBUS (adds temperature monitoring + digital communication)
